column4: maybe someone can help, I've been looking for a winamp like alternative to rhythmbox, I've got audacious and xmms installed at the moment  but in both of these I can't find a media library window like winamp has, any suggestions?
usually the playlist has fewer or select songs than are in the library
well xmms etc are basically winamp classic.  tried other alternative players like listen or banshee?
i suspect amarok will solve all my problems but the hefty download size of 46mb on ubuntu is delaying me
yes, apt will grab the required kde libs.  just as gnome apps can work in kde or xfce for that matter.
how are you finding listen?  i quite like it but keep going back to just plain bmp.  (audacious seems sluggish on my pc)
I didn't use listen more than a few hours after I couldn't find a library
couldn't find?  don't you just set it in prefs?
um, what, I looked but didn't see the option. Let me check again real quick :P
oh yeah i did that but I'd really prefer something that brings up a seperate library window that has easy search of the whole library and playlist selection.
thanks for the advice, I've got to go.
